projectGridLines.title: Title: Backend Engineering In the Identity Verification Domain
projectGridLines.description:
Title: Backend Engineering In the Identity Verification Domain


Description: Developing inhouse API solutions for fraud prevention, risk mitigation and

Risk Orchestration

Skill sets: Coding - Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer

Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.

Basic programming skills in one or more programming languages (e.g., Python, Java,

JavaScript, C++, etc.).

Familiarity with software development concepts, tools, and methodologies.

Traits expectation: Strong passion for software development and technology.

Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.

Strong communication and teamwork skills.

Eagerness to learn and adapt in a fast-paced and collaborative environment.

Expected learning:

Software Development: Collaborate with our engineering team on software development

projects, including coding, testing, and debugging.

Feature Enhancement: Assist in adding new features and functionalities to our SaaS

applications, ensuring they meet quality standards and user requirements.

Bug Fixes: Identify and resolve software defects and issues to maintain the reliability and

performance of our products.

Documentation: Create and update technical documentation for software components,

APIs, and procedures.

Code Review: Participate in code reviews to learn best practices and contribute to the

team's code quality.

Testing: Conduct unit testing and assist in the development of test cases to ensure

software reliability.

Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including product management

and design, to understand project requirements and deliver high-quality solutions.

Learning and Growth: Proactively seek opportunities for skill development and learning

from experienced engineers within the company.

Specific courses required for project execution: DSA, OOP, Computer Programming
